text: Not sure of the proper channel to put this in but I noticed that this link for advanced menus goes to the old version of the Navigation editor.
<@UD53A9UUR> are you doing the development on it? Have you been using some of their development workflows and tools?
we use the branching.  we are working concurrently with another dev team.

Has anyone ever seen an issue where HubSpot is adding extra quote marks to code? I have added a no follow no index tab to a template and to a page editor header with the following code: `<meta name="robots" content="noindex,nofollow">` but when I look at the source file of the published page it has reneder an extra set of quotes `<meta name=""robots"" content=""noindex,nofollow"">` causing Google not to recognize the tag an index the page. Removing the quotes in the headers fixes this, but I don’t like having extra quotes randomly show up.
haven't run into that before... thanks for the heads up. maybe try single quotes?
hi! Im new here. can I ask where can we access our sandbox?
<@U22PKFRU5>
Welcome! You can create a developer sandbox account here: <https://app.HubSpot.com/signup/developers>

We have enabled minifying the script on prod. However, I have not convinced the team to extend the cache time for those scripts. So you may get an un-minified version occasionally, but subsequent requests should get minified.
seems like the “menu” field when building a module defaults to a horizontal menu… is there  a way to set it to a vertical menu or should i just do that via CSS?
:point_up_2: This is for API development. If you'd like a CMS sandbox, you can get that in step 2 of: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/discoverykit>
requires editing the hubl tag. if you view the hubl documentation for HubSpot supported tags look for menu, the same attributes apply to the custom module menus
there it is sweet thanks jon
and yeah i should have know that

Hi guys, I'm trying to create a landing page with a simple lead capture form, with one complication.  I'd like the street address capture to perform real time address validation via a third part API, and am wondering how this should be structured.
do I need to create a new account?
is this the same sandbox for the web development?
yes, that’s the cms sandbox
and Yes I think you need to create a new account through that to get access to it.
If you use your email address you’ve used for past projects that may let you access it through that account
I am interested in this as well, can we create a clone of a live account so all settings/etc are the same?
I believe you’d have to manually set everything the same <@U98RGFUQZ>
Could be a bug. But I am not able reproduce. I tried both `Head Options` in the template editor, and `Head HTML` in the content settings.

<@U98RGFUQZ> yes, <@U7SL518D6> is correct. It’s a completely fresh account. So you’d need to manually set everything up. You can push assets (templates, modules, etc) between accounts tho. 

That said - we are actively exploring how to build a better staging/testing environment (which seems like what you’re hinting at).
Yeah, a full "clone" of sorts would be helpful as we so often have a number of intricacies we need to deal with and they don't show up, of course, until it's in production
<@U7SL518D6> Thank you for confirming my nightmare haha
For most things content staging solves a lot of problems
Yeah. We have a client with a lot of cooks in the kitchen often making changes and updates to different integrations and breaking things
Ahh been there dont love that
